javadoc: The OperandFieldLocation class contains specific location information within the OPERAND field of a CodeUnitLocation object.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: program
params.comment: the program of the location

params.name: addr
params.comment: address of the location; should not be null

params.name: componentPath
params.comment:
array of indexes for each nested data component; the
 index is the data component's index within its parent; may be null

params.name: rep
params.comment: the String representation of the operand.

params.name: opIndex
params.comment: the index of the operand at this location.

params.name: characterOffset
params.comment: the character position from the beginning of the operand.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: program
params.comment: the program of the location

params.name: addr
params.comment: address of the location; should not be null

params.name: componentPath
params.comment:
array of indexes for each nested data component; the
 index is the data component's index within its parent; may be null

params.name: refAddr
params.comment:
the "referred to" address if the location is
 over a reference; may be null

params.name: rep
params.comment: the String representation of the operand.

params.name: opIndex
params.comment: the index indicating the operand the location is on.

params.name: subOpIndex
params.comment:
the index of the Object within the operand, this can
                   be used to call an instructions getOpObjects() method

params.name: characterOffset
params.comment: the character position from the beginning of the operand field

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a new OperandFieldLocation object for an instruction operand.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program of the location

params.name: addr
params.comment: address of the location; should not be null

params.name: variableOffset
params.comment: associated variable offset or null

params.name: refAddr
params.comment:
the "referred to" address if the location is
 over a reference; may be null

params.name: rep
params.comment: the String representation of the operand.

params.name: opIndex
params.comment: the index indicating the operand the location is on.

params.name: subOpIndex
params.comment:
the index of the Object within the operand, this can
                   be used to call an instructions getOpObjects() method

params.name: characterOffset
params.comment: the character position from the beginning of the operand field

methods.javadoc:
Default constructor needed for restoring
 an operand field location from XML.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Default constructor needed for restoring
 an operand field location from XML.

methods.javadoc: Returns VariableOffset object if applicable or null
methods.name: getVariableOffset
methods.comment: Returns VariableOffset object if applicable or null

methods.javadoc: Returns a string representation of the opernand at this location.
methods.name: getOperandRepresentation
methods.comment: Returns a string representation of the opernand at this location.

methods.javadoc: Returns the index of the operand at this location.
methods.name: getOperandIndex
methods.comment: Returns the index of the operand at this location.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the sub operand index at this location.
 This index can be used on the instruction.getOpObjects()
 to find the actual object (Address, Register, Scalar) the
 cursor is over.
@return 0-n if over a valid OpObject, -1 otherwise
methods.name: getSubOperandIndex
methods.comment:
Returns the sub operand index at this location.
 This index can be used on the instruction.getOpObjects()
 to find the actual object (Address, Register, Scalar) the
 cursor is over.

return.comment: 0-n if over a valid OpObject, -1 otherwise

methods.javadoc: Returns a String representation of this location.
methods.name: toString
methods.comment: Returns a String representation of this location.

name: OperandFieldLocation
comment:
The OperandFieldLocation class contains specific location information
 within the OPERAND field of a CodeUnitLocation object.
